data.event: Originally named Monadnock No. 6, the town was granted in 1752 by Governor Benning Wentworth.
It was first settled in 1767 by Breed Batchelder.
On February 22, 1774, the town was incorporated by Governor John Wentworth as Packersfield, after a major proprietor, Thomas Packer, the sheriff at Portsmouth.
The name was changed in 1814 to Nelson in honor of Viscount Horatio Nelson, British admiral and naval hero.
The mills have since closed, and Munsonville is today a resort of summer homes.
